text: [Music]
hi this is Brian with Amazon Web
Services and in this short video we're
gonna take a look at how we take
inventory services from ec2 Systems
Manager and tie it in to AWS config so
we have long term data and can look at
different changes throughout time so
let's go take a look at AWS config we
start at the AWS console and we go into
ec2 config from ec2 config we can see
these rules resources and settings in
settings I'm going to turn off my ec2
config because I already have it turned
on and I'll show you how to turn it on
so that we tie it in to inventory
services so what I'm doing here is I'm
selecting managed inventory services and
this will tie config into just the SSM
inventory or I can have it record
everything in my account and that's what
I'm doing is actually going back and
turn it on in recording everything in my
account inventory is a piece of all of
that but it will record everything else
as well then to go look at the
information I want to go to resource
inventory and select my managed
inventory here it lists all the
different instances and all their
historical ratings so I'll go down and
select one of the instances in this
instance it's a Windows instance and we
can see that we have data back to March
13th and we see ten changes happen there
if I click on the changes we can see
what's changed and here we see that it's
the SSM agent was updated on that date
and it changed several pieces of that of
that agent if I click further I can see
information like on this date we had 22
changes and oh look at that it's the
windows update ran on that day and we
had 22 different patches install on
march 17th at 8:30 and the next one here
we look at there's just been one change
and it's the AWS agent was updated and
there we go that's how you integrate AWS
config with inventory services tune in
for more videos on ec2 Systems Manager
thanks for watching
you
[Music]
